Description:
Unit On Own Title In The Heart Of Kennington
Tucked away in a quiet blue-chip location and only a short stroll to Strath Village Shopping Centre, Kennington Reservoir and LaTrobe University is this spacious 2-bedroom unit on its own title, which means NO owners corp fees.
Features include lock-up garage, heating and cooling, spacious bedrooms with built in robes and a low-maintenance and private rear yard with room to grow a garden or for a small pet to play!
Near new bathroom has recently been fitted with some finishing touches required and a lick of paint through will realise its true potential.
A great buy for retirees, first home buyers and investors alike.
Owner must sell!

Description:
A Very Popular Location in Kennington
An extremely well presented Colonial Style unit in a fantastic location. Kitchen with Gas Cooking and plenty of cupboard space. Spacious lounge with gas and electric heating. Two bedrooms which include wall to wall built in robes. Private Backyard, single lock up garage with workshop space at the end. The property is in quiet court surrounded by beautiful gardens, not to far from the CBD, public transport close by, schools and shops. A prime property in a prime location.
Adrian Robinson : 0408 389 680

Description:
Style and The City
Located just a heartbeat from the CBD, this fully renovated and extended Victorian home offers the perfect chic city lifestyle.
Picture perfect behind the picket fence and high hedge, the classic double-fronted period facade belies the perfect balance of old and new inside.
With soaring ceilings overhead and Baltic pine timber floors underfoot, the traditional central hallway is flanked by the main bedroom with built-in-robes and the second bedroom or home office with open fireplace.
Further along the hall is a third, robed bedroom and a stunning bathroom transformation featuring Natural Sandstone floor and wall tiling, walk-in-shower, full bath, vanity, toilet and a clever European-style laundry hidden behind double doors.
A stunning new extension opens to a spacious living area where a wall of glass beams light into every corner of the open-plan living and dining spaces and the kitchen with it's granite overlay benches, big five-burner Smeg stainless steel cook top and rangehood, Bosch dishwasher and island work station.
Double sliding doors lead to the wrap-around timber deck with built-in gas barbecue, making the perfect inside-to-outside entertaining area.
The landscaped rear garden is totally captivating with tall shade trees inside the fence and old red-brick paving under a sunny sitting area complete with pizza oven.
Under-house storage is large enough to house three water tanks, a boat and more.
Other quirky extras include raised timber garden beds full of vegetables and there's even a neat little chicken run.
The rear 14.5 x 4.5 metre garage accessed by remote-controlled roller door from Havlin Street is complete with workshop area and loads of shelving.
There's nothing to be done and nothing overlooked in this masterful mix and traditional and modern living.
Mark OShea : 0437 745 726
Insights: 88 Mundy Street, KENNINGTON VIC 3550 was last sold in 2012 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in KENNINGTON have recently been sold.

Description:
Complete The Dream
We offer for Auction this partially completed home situated close to the University on the corner of Edwards Road and Federation Terrace.
Placed on an allotment of approx 531m2 and a total floor area by plan of approx 264m2 or 28 squares including the garage & Al-fresco area.
Plans show a layout comprising of 4 bedrooms, main with ensuite & WIR, separate lounge, family & kitchen meals area. Built to lock up the property does require the fit out to be completed. Plans, engineering and building surveyors reports available on request. Sale price will be plus GST.

Description:
Its Got The Lot
This is your chance to secure a neat home in a prime position without the hefty price tag.
Located in a popular street smack in the middle of Kennington, this cheerful, light and bright three bedroom weatherboard home is squeaky clean throughout and loaded with possibilities for first home buyers or smart investors. An elevated front verandah leads to the entry hall with polished pine flooring and a spacious lounge with split system air conditioning and adjacent functional kitchen with gas cooker and roomy meals area, 3 piece bathroom, internal toilet and laundry, plus there's plenty of storage throughout.
Sited on a good-sized allotment, the neat yard has secure Colorbond fencing all round, it requires minimal maintenance and includes a car/caravan port and single garage with concrete flooring.
The prime position is close to Strath Village, schools, the uni, public transport, parks and reserves and just about everything else needed for an easy lifestyle and could be the ideal spot for townhouses down the track.
It's got the lot, position, presentation and potential. Live in it or rent it out now now while you plan for your future.
Mark OShea : 0437 745 726

Description:
Spacious Unit Great Location
Spacious, light and airy, this unit has so much more to offer than the average. Two bedrooms have big built-in robes and a large open living zone allows space for a study area. There's loads of storage cupboards, plus a generously proportioned Euro-style laundry. The securely-fenced rear courtyard is fully paved and ready for a pergola or umbrella to shelter an alfresco setting. It even has plenty of room for a garden shed. Located to perfectly suit professionals, university students and retirees - investors and home-seekers alike will be impressed. Positioned to take advantage of public transport, nearby shopping centres and recreational reserves, it is a true crowd-pleaser.
Nekti Tzouroutis : 0412 242 321

Description:
Easy Living In Quiet Court
The great location of a quiet court, close to La Trobe University, schools, Strath Hill and Strath Village shopping centres and the ease of maintenance of this three-bedroom home on a 507-square-metre-block makes this Russell Parsons-built home an ideal proposition for a range of buyers from first home to downsizers to investors. A mix of Oregon beams and pine boards are used in the cathedral ceilings which straddle the north-west side of the house, their loftiness adding another dimension to the interior. The house has a gas heater and a reverse-cycle split-system. Big windows in the formal lounge and dining rooms overlook a paved, sunny terrace with a vine-clad pergola above, the perfect place for a barbecue or early morning cuppa. Rustic slate flooring is used throughout the house (except for the bedrooms and formal lounge room), the colours combining well with the pale timber cabinetry in the galley-style kitchen, and the neutral décor. There's a dishwasher, above-bench fan-forced electric oven and hotplates in the kitchen. Storage includes a built-in pantry and an appliance hutch. Three bedrooms are on the south side of the house. Two have built-in wardrobes and the main has a walk-in wardrobe. All share a four-piece bathroom which has two-way access. There is a second separate toilet with hand basin adjoins the laundry. The double garage has roller doors and can be accessed from the house.

The main bedroom is of a good size with built in robe & ceiling fan, a second more compact bedroom, comfortable lounge with gas heater and reverse cycle split system, kitchen with gas stove, three piece bathroom, separate laundry, single carport and a garden shed. Investor's or retirees should act quickly as this all adds up to great buying.

Description:
Unique Property In Prime Location
A classic home in Kennington on a prime, private 1800 square metre allotment , elevated with views, inground pool and a bush outlook at your back door.
In an established
treed garden setting the Brick Veneer home with T/C Tile Roof is light and bright and offers a garden view from every window.
Accommodation comprises Entrance Hall, 4 Bedrooms with B.I.Robes, 2 Bathrooms, Sitting Room with Open Fire Place, formal Dining Room or Multi/Purpose Room, Family Room and well appointed Kitchen with family meals area.
Features ducted gas heating, 3
airconditioning units, high ceilings and a fantastic outdoor entertaining area.
Double garage with auto door, workshop, underhouse storage and side access to rear yard for boat, caravan etc.
A rare opportunity to purchase a much loved family home ready for the next chapter.
Often asked for - rarely available.
Terms 10% Deposit Balance 60 days.
Offers prior to Auction considered.

Description:
Californian Bungalow Plus Cottage on 1/4 Acre With Reservoir Views
First time on the market since 1940 this substantial Californian Bungalow with original features such as wide hallways, leadlight windows and spacious rooms with high ceilings. Typical of its era it is currently set out with two large bedrooms, sleep out, separate formal lounge, country style kitchen with scullery and internal bathroom and laundry facilities. Added to this is a self contained cottage which features, separate bedroom, combined kitchen lounge and combined bathroom/ laundry. Outside boasts a huge carport, separate lock up garage and other sundry shedding. The Property offers a solid base to renovate and perhaps extend (STCA) and make use of the fantastic water views of Kennington Reservoir and is truly a once in a lifetime opportunity.
Adjacent vacant allotment also available at Auction on Saturday 25th February at 12:15pm.
Insights: 45 Reservoir Road, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2012 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.
